intro: Ginoria glabra, commonly known as the smooth ginoria, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Geraniaceae and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and thrives in full sun. Its flowers are usually pink or white, and it produces capsules as its fruit. Ginoria glabra is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens.
